# Title
World Indicators (2022)

---

## Data Used in Slides
```{python}
import pandas as pd, matplotlib.pyplot as plt
```

# Overview
- Data: World Development Indicators via **wbgapi**  
- Indicators: GDP per capita (USD), Life expectancy (years), Inflation rate (%)  
- Tools: pandas and matplotlib  
- Year: 2022  

# Load Data
```{python}
import pandas as pd, matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import os
df = pd.read_csv("wdi.csv")
df = df[["country", "gdp_per_capita", "life_expectancy", "inflation_rate"]].dropna()
```

# Summary Statistics
```{python}
desc = df[["gdp_per_capita", "life_expectancy", "inflation_rate"]].describe().T.reset_index()
desc.rename(columns={"index": "indicator"}, inplace=True)
desc
```

GDP per capita averages about $17,468 with wide dispersion.
Life expectancy averages 72.9 years, typically between 68–78.
Inflation averages 12.7%, showing high variation.

# Correlation
```{python}
corr = df[["gdp_per_capita", "life_expectancy", "inflation_rate"]].corr()
corr
```

GDP per capita and life expectancy are moderately positively correlated (r ≈ 0.6).
Inflation shows weak negative correlations with both variables.

# Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita
```{python}
plt.figure()
plt.scatter(df["gdp_per_capita"], df["life_expectancy"], alpha=0.7)
plt.xlabel("GDP per capita (USD)")
plt.ylabel("Life expectancy (years)")
plt.title("Life expectancy vs GDP per capita (2022)")
plt.show()
```

Higher GDP per capita generally aligns with longer life expectancy.

# Inflation Distribution
```{python}
plt.figure()
plt.hist(df["inflation_rate"].dropna(), bins=20)
plt.xlabel("Inflation rate (%)")
plt.ylabel("Number of countries")
plt.title("Distribution of Inflation Rates (2022)")
plt.show()
```

Inflation rates are highly skewed, with some extreme outliers.

# Top 10 GDP per Capita Countries
```{python}
top10 = df.sort_values("gdp_per_capita", ascending=False).head(10).iloc[::-1]
plt.figure()
plt.barh(top10["country"], top10["gdp_per_capita"])
plt.xlabel("GDP per capita (USD)")
plt.title("Top 10 Countries by GDP per Capita (2022)")
plt.show()
```

Wealth is concentrated among a small group of countries.

# Conclusion
Economic and health outcomes remain uneven globally.
Strong GDP–life expectancy link highlights the role of economic development.
Inflation disparities reflect diverse fiscal conditions.
